me.joeycumines.javapromises.v1

Class PromiseBase<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.joeycumines.javapromises.v1.PromiseBase<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Promise<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PromiseRunnable, PromiseStage

    public abstract class PromiseBase<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Promise<T>
    A simple thread-safe Promise implementation sans then, except, and always.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.Object lock
      Use this as a lock against which you can synchronize the state.

    • Field Detail

      • lock

        protected final java.lang.Object lock
        Use this as a lock against which you can synchronize the state.

        This used to be another object instanced by the constructor, but it has been changed to this, for now, since there is not any real need for a separate lock object.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public PromiseState getState()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Get the current state of the promise.

        A promise's initial state is PENDING, will change at most once, to either resolved states, FULFILLED or REJECTED.

        Specified by:
        getState in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        The state of the promise.

      • resolve

        protected PromiseBase<T> resolve(Promise<? extends T> promise)
                          throws SelfResolutionException,
                                 MutatedStateException
        Resolve this promise with the same value/exception and state as another promise. Resolving null will fulfill this with null.

        Note that this may happen asynchronously, subsequent calls to resolve may fail silently. Take this into consideration especially if exposing this method externally.

        Circular references are not checked, but we do take care not to directly resolve this.

        Parameters:
        promise - The promise to resolve.
        Returns:
        This promise.
        Throws:
        SelfResolutionException - If promise is this, or the promise is resolved to this.
        MutatedStateException - If this was already resolved, at the time of this call. Not triggered immediately if promise is PENDING.

      • sync

        public void sync()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Calling this method will block the current thread until this is resolved (not PENDING).

        All responsibility for sane use of this method lies with the caller.

        Specified by:
        sync in interface Promise<T>

      • thenSync

        public T thenSync()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning a value if it resolved with FULFILLED, otherwise returning null.
        Specified by:
        thenSync in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        The resolved value, or null if REJECTED.
        See Also:
        Promise.sync()

        public java.lang.Throwable exceptSync()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning a value if it resolved with REJECTED, otherwise returning null.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        The reason for rejection, or null if FULFILLED.
